intro: Galeandra chapadensis, commonly known as the Chapada orchid, is a species of orchid native to Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), while its inflorescence bears a cluster of showy, pink or purple flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
